com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin

Class DocumentViewerFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin.DocumentViewerFactory

  • public abstract class DocumentViewerFactory
extends Object
    A DocumentViewerFactory creates a DocumentViewer which displays one or more Geneious documents to the user. Note that one instance of the factory will be created for each document class, so instance variables and data associated with the documents themselves should not be stored in this class. Instead store them in the DocumentViewer returned by the createViewer(com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.documents.AnnotatedPluginDocument[]).

    A plugin may provide a set of DocumentViewerFactories via GeneiousPlugin.getDocumentViewerFactories(). The following example shows how to create a DocumentViewerFactory as an anonymous inner class. In this example, the factory creates viewers that display a single sequence with large text. 

    
 new DocumentViewerFactory(){

    //This method creates a DocumentViewer from an array of AnnotatedPluginDocument objects
    //Since the DocumentSelectionSignature (see below) allows only single documents to be passed,
    //we can safely assume that the array is of length 1.
    public DocumentViewer createViewer(final AnnotatedPluginDocument[] docs){


        return new DocumentViewer(){

            final String residues = ((SequenceDocument)docs[0].getDocument()).getSequenceString().toUpperCase();
            final Font font = new Font("monospaced",Font.PLAIN,48);


            //The DocumentViewer class contains one abstract method
            //to get a component for viewing.
            public JPanel getComponent(){

                JPanel canvas = new JPanel(){

                    public void paintComponent(Graphics g){

                        //we need to clear the background
                        g.setColor(Color.white);
                        g.fillRect(0,0,getWidth(),getHeight());

                        //then draw the sequence string onto the canvas
                        g.setColor(Color.black);
                        g.setFont(font);
                        g.drawString(residues,10,50);
                    }

                    public Dimension getPreferredSize(){
                        //this calculates how wide the text is going to be.
                        FontRenderContext frc = new FontRenderContext(new AffineTransform(), false, false);
                        Rectangle2D fontBounds = font.getStringBounds(residues, frc);
                        return new Dimension((int)fontBounds.getWidth()+20,(int)fontBounds.getHeight()+60);
                    }
                };

                //we put the main canvas into a JScrollPane in case the sequence is bigger than the viewer window.
                JScrollPane scroller = new JScrollPane(canvas);

                //since we return a JPanel, we need to put the JScrollPane into a new JPanel
                JPanel holder = new JPanel(new BorderLayout());
                holder.add(scroller,BorderLayout.CENTER);

                return holder;
            }

            //DocumentViewer contains two methods for printing, getExtendedPrintable and getPrintable
            //it is suggested that you use getExtendedPrintable for more full-featured printing
            public ExtendedPrintable getExtendedPrintable(){
                return new ExtendedPrintable(){
                    //see ExtendedPrintable for an example implementation.
                };
            }

            //This method allows the viewer to link in to Geneious's search feature.
            public Findable getFindable(){
                return new Findable(){
                    //see Findable for an example implementation.
                };
            }

            //if a NoLongerViewedListener is supplied, Geneious will call it when the document is moved
            //offscreen.  isTemporary is true if the user is switching to another viewer of the same document
            //and false otherwise.
            //NoLongerViewedReason has two possible values, NO_SPECIFIC_REASON and DOCUMENT_GENERATED.  You may
            //want to check for this if you want to display a special message to the user when a new document is
            //generated.
            public NoLongerViewedListener getNoLongerViewedListener(){
                return new NoLongerViewedListener(){
                    //see NoLongerViewedListener for an example implementation.
                };
            }

            //Providing an ActionProvider allows your plugin to link in to some of Geneious actions.
            //In this example we are allowing the sequence to be copied to the clipboard when the user
            //selects "Copy" from the edit menu.
            public ActionProvider getActionProvider() {
                return new ActionProvider(){
                    //see ActionProvider for an example implementation.
                };
            }
        };
    }

    //DocumentViewerFactories tell Geneious what types of documents they can accept with a list of DocumentSelectionSignature objects.
    //This particular DocumentViewerFactory accepts a single SequenceDocument
    public DocumentSelectionSignature[] getSelectionSignatures(){
        return new DocumentSelectionSignature[]{new DocumentSelectionSignature(SequenceDocument.class,1,1)};
    }

    public String getHelp(){
        return "A Viewer";
    }

    public String getDescription(){
        return "Ludicrous, isn't it?";
    }

    //This is the string that is used for the name of the tab in the viewer window
    public String getName(){
        return "Ludicrously Giant Sequence View";
    }

};

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public abstract String getName()
        Viewer user visible name. This will be used as the name displayed in the tabs of available viewers for all viewers created by this factory. However, a viewer may choose to return a non-null value from DocumentViewer.getName() to provide a name that better matches the data.
        Returns:
        viewer name. Cannot be null
        See Also:
        DocumentViewer.getName()

      • getDescription

        public abstract String getDescription()
        Description of the viewers purpose and how it is accessed.
        Returns:
        viewer description. Cannot be null

      • getHelp

        public abstract String getHelp()
        Get help.
        Returns:
        Help for this viewer in the form of HTML or plain text.

        May return null, but please make an effort to provide some guidance to your users. This text may appear in the help panel within geneious, in the online manual etc.

      • getSelectionSignatures

        public abstract DocumentSelectionSignature[] getSelectionSignatures()
        Specifies the type of document(s) viewer can display.
        Returns:
        set of signatures. Cannot be null

      • createViewer

        public abstract DocumentViewer createViewer(AnnotatedPluginDocument[] annotatedDocuments)
        Viewer as a Java component.

        This method will always be called in the dispatch/AWT/Swing thread so it is safe to construct componenets etc. Processor intensive operations should not be done in this thread as it will cause Geneious to hang until finished. Such work should be done in a seperate thread (eg. new Thread(...).start()).

        The implementation may call AnnotatedPluginDocument.getDocumentOrNull() on any of the given annotatedDocuments and safely rely on it not returning null. Or alternatively use AnnotatedPluginDocument.getDocumentOrCrash() which won't crash when called from inside createViewer. Note that if the DocumentViewer returns false from loadInternalPluginDocuments() then this won't be true.

        May return null to have no viewer displayed (this should only be used if the selection signature is not sufficient).
        Parameters:
        annotatedDocuments - documents to display. list is guaranteed to match one of the signatures.
        Returns:
        viewer a DocumentViewer for the given documents, or null to have no viewer displayed

      • getPrecedence

        public DocumentViewerFactory.ViewPrecedence getPrecedence()
        Provide a rough guide about the social status of the viewer.
        Returns:
        viewer precedence (medium by default, override this method to change precedence)

      • loadInternalPluginDocuments

        public boolean loadInternalPluginDocuments()
        Returns:
        true if this viewer will ever call AnnotatedPluginDocument.getDocumentOrNull(), false if not. If this is true then the program will load the document first so it can display a progress bar to the user. Should be false for viewers which deal only with AnnotatedPluginDocuments and never PluginDocuments so the viewer can be displayed quickly without first loading the internal documents.

      • isDisplayedInHelpPanel

        public boolean isDisplayedInHelpPanel()
        A viewer can be displayed as a tab in the help panel on the right hand side of the main window. The behaviour of a viewer in the help panel is different to a standard viewer and the viewer will not be displayed in the normal document panel.

        When a help panel viewer matches a selected document the help panel will be shown if currently hidden. Once a viewer has been displayed in the help panel it will remain there until the program is terminated. Any subsequent document selections which do not match a help panel viewer will not affect the viewer. When another selection matching any help panel viewer is made then the previously viewed document will be replaced with the new one in the same tab in the help panel. All help panel viewers share a single tab in the help panel (the name of which changes). So only one help panel viewer can be displayed at a time.

        Returns:
        true to have this viewer appear in the help panel, false to appear in the document viewer panel.

      • getKeyForPerDocumentPreferencesNeededDuringInitialization

        public String getKeyForPerDocumentPreferencesNeededDuringInitialization()
        Returns the name of an additional XML key used with PerDocumentPreferences for viewers that need access to the preferences during their swing thread initialization. Core Geneious will preload this XML from the database during the document loading progress bar before initializing the viewer.
        Returns:
        the name of an additional XML key used with PerDocumentPreferences for viewers that need access to the preferences during their swing thread initialization. Or null if no additional XML is needed during initialization
        Since:
        API 4.60 (Geneious 5.6.0)

      • isDisplayableInSecondaryFrame

        public boolean isDisplayableInSecondaryFrame()
        If false then this viewer will never be available in secondary frames which the user opens (by double clicking or selecting and "Open in new window" action).
        Returns:
        false to make viewer not available in secondary frames, true otherwise.

      • getIcons

        public Icons getIcons()
        An icon which will be displayed (at 16x16) next to the viewer name in the tabbed pane. Will not be displayed if there is only one viewer available for a selection.
        Returns:
        icons for this viewer or null for no icon.

      • isProOnly

        public boolean isProOnly()
        Returns true if DocumentViewers created by this factory requires an active license. The default implementation returns false.
        Returns:
        true if DocumentViewers created by this factory requires an active license

      • getPossibleExternalActions

        public List<GeneiousAction> getPossibleExternalActions()
        Get a list of GeneiousActions for viewer actions that should be displayed in the main menu or other location outside the viewer's toolbar. This is required because any actions that wish to be in the menu must be added to the menu on start up, before the viewer is displayed.

        The actual GeneiousActions (return matching values from GeneiousActionOptions.getIdentifier()) must be returned from DocumentViewer.getActionProvider().getExternalActions(). The menu will then link in to the action returned from the currently visible DocumentViewer instance.

        Returns:
        a list of GeneiousActions for viewer actions that should be displayed in the main menu or other location outside the viewer's toolbar
